title: Biden envoy in Israel as northern border tensions flare
message:
Israel and Hezbollah, a Hamas ally, have traded near-daily cross-border fire since the Palestinian militant group's October 7 attack on Israel which triggered war in the Gaza Strip.
But exchanges have escalated and last week saw Hezbollah's largest simultaneous attack, after an Israeli strike killed a senior commander from the group.
"I can confirm that (US President Joe) Biden's envoy... met with our prime minister," Israeli government spokesman David Mencer told a press briefing.
Hezbollah last week said it has carried out more than 2,100 military operations against Israel since October 8, the day after Hamas's attack.
Hezbollah escalated attacks last week after a commander, Taleb Abdallah, was killed in an Israeli strike in the village of Jouaiyya.
location: Jaffra - a Lebanese town near the Israeli border where Hezbollah commander Taleb Abdallah
event_breakdown: IDF attacked Hezbollah targets in Lebanon

title: Top ISIS leader in Somalia was target of US airstrike
message:
(SOMALIA) — A United States military airstrike in Somalia targeted the top Islamic State leader in late May, but it remains unclear if the leader was killed in the airstrike, according to U.S. officials.
Abdulqadir Mumin has been identified by the U.S. as the head of the Islamic State in Somalia, an African affiliate of the terror group once known as ISIS.
A fourth U.S. official would only confirm that a senior Islamic State leader was the target of the strike but would not comment on the individual’s name.
NBC News was first to report that Mumin was the target of the May 31 airstrike and that he had become the global leader of Islamic State.
The NCTC describes Mumin as the founder and leader of the Islamic State in Somalia that operates primarily in the semi-autonomous area of northeastern Somalia known as Puntland.
event_breakdown:
Security Event 1: US Military Airstrike in Somalia
Location: Somalia
A United States military airstrike in Somalia targeted the top Islamic State leader, Abdulqadir Mumin, in late May. It remains unclear if he was killed in the airstrike.

title: Israeli psychic Uri Geller claims he stopped Iranian drone attack
message:
Israeli mystifier and psychic Uri Geller claimed he played a part in helping thwart the April Iranian drone and missile attack on Israel.
“I can’t go into detail because the operation was classified, but I played a part in bringing down the Iranian drones that attacked Israel in April,” Geller told The Jerusalem Post.
Iron Shield was seen as a major success, with Israel claiming 99% of missiles and drones were successfully intercepted.
Objects are seen in the sky above Jerusalem after Iran launched drones and missiles towards Israel, in Jerusalem April 14, 2024.
This article is a preview of a fuller wide-ranging discussion with Geller on the Israel-Hamas War and Israeli public diplomacy.
event_breakdown:
Iran-Israeli missile attacks
Israeli military claims to have successfully intercepted Iranian drones and missiles that were launched towards Israel, in Jerusalem

message:
An Israel Air Force (IAF) aircraft eliminated Hezbollah terrorist Muhammad Mustafa Ayoub in the Selaa area in southern Lebanon, the military said on Monday evening.
The IDF noted that Ayub was an important operative in the Rocket and Missile Department of Hezbollah's Nasser Unit.
IDF jets strike in southern Lebanon.

title: Report : Attack that killed 8 IDF soldiers caused by anti - tank missile
message:
Israeli soldiers stand around the flag-draped casket of Israeli soldier Wassem Mahmoud, who was killed when an armoured personnel carrier exploded near the southern Gaza city of Rafah, during his funeral in Beit Jann.
Eight Israeli soldiers have been killed in fighting in Rafah in the southern Gaza Strip, the armed forces said on Saturday.
Ilia Yefimovich/dpaThe Israeli army assumes that an anti-tank missile was used in Saturday's attack on an Israeli armoured vehicle in Rafah in the southern Gaza Strip, which killed eight soldiers, according to Israeli media.
It was initially reported that it was unclear whether the explosion was caused by an anti-tank missile or a booby trap.
Due to the many deaths and the catastrophic humanitarian situation, Israel's actions in the Gaza war are internationally controversial.
event_breakdown: Israeli soldiers killed by anti-tank missile in Gaza Strip fighting - An anti-tank missile attack killed eight Israeli soldiers in the southern Gaza Strip, the army said on Saturday, in some of the deadliest fighting between Israel and Palestinian militants in years. The Reuters news agency reported that the Israel Defense Forces (IDF) had taken over suspected smuggling tunnels on the Gaza-Egypt border and had shelled militant positions in Gaza on Friday, killing at least three Palestinians.  The IDF said it had "eliminated" three top Islamic Jihad commanders. The IDF said three of those killed in the fighting were top leaders of the Islamic Jihad group, and it accused the group of trying to smuggle explosives into the Gaza Strip. The IDF said it struck back at the Islamic Jihad, when it fired a missile at a Hamas-run office building in Gaza City, killing three members of Islamic Jihad who were apparently in the building at the time. Islamic Jihad is a Palestinian militant group that is based in Gaza, and it often launches attacks into Israel. IDF officials said that they were prepared to strike back at Islamic Jihad if it reacted to its attack on Rafah, although they also said that they expected the Islamic Jihad to fight to defend its military positions.

title: Will Hezbollah new arsenal be enough to deter war with Israel ?
message:
Meanwhile, Israel has conducted strikes increasingly deeper inside Lebanon and shown less restraint over assassinating senior Hezbollah members.
Hezbollah has exchanged daily fire with Israel since October 8, shortly after Israel launched its ongoing campaign in the Gaza Strip.
It fired missiles deeper into Israel and even launched missiles from a drone within Israeli airspace, a notable first.
“As usual, this is designed to show the potential costs of full-scale war as Hezbollah wants Israel to believe that none of its assets are safe.”RELATED Is Israel gearing up for war with Hezbollah?
But with Hezbollah forces increasingly ready for total war with Israel, perhaps that moment has already been and gone.

title: IDF General Tells Troops to Continue Rafah Operation Until Hamas Is Defeated
message:
Directive issued after eight Israeli soldiers were killed in a vehicle explosion during an operation in Rafah.
The Israel Defense Forces (IDF) vowed to continue military operations in Rafah until the Hamas terrorist group is defeated.
This followed an explosion in southern Gaza that killed eight Israeli soldiers.
IDF Southern Command chief Maj. Gen. Yaron Finkelman said at a June 15 meeting with commanders in Rafah that they must continue their fight against Hamas as the explosion is being investigated.
IDF spokesperson Daniel Hagari said on June 15 that eight Israeli soldiers were killed inside an armored vehicle during an operation in Tel al-Sultan in Rafah.
event_breakdown: IDF vows to continue military operations in Rafah until Hamas is defeated following an explosion that killed eight Israeli soldiers.

title: US Navy rescues crew from ship struck by Houthis
message:
CAIRO: The US Naval Forces Central Command (NAVCENT) said on Sunday that it had rescued the crew from the Liberian-flagged, Greek-owned bulk carrier M/V Tutor that was attacked by Yemen’s Iran-aligned Houthis on 12 June in the Red Sea.
Sailors assigned to the Dwight D. Eisenhower Carrier Strike Group airlifted the crew out on Saturday, NAVCENT said, adding that one civilian sailor remained missing.
The attack, which occurred near the Yemeni port of Hodeidah, caused severe flooding and damage to the engine room and left the Tutor unable to manoeuvre.
Crew evacuated from vessel hit by Houthis, search for sailor continuesOn Saturday, the United Kingdom Maritime Trade Operations (UKMTO) said the ship’s crew was evacuated and that the abandoned vessel was drifting in the Red Sea.
The Houthis claimed responsibility for the small sea craft and missile attacks it used to target the ship as part of their ongoing campaign which they say is in support of the Palestinians and is focused on ships bound for Israel.
location: The specified location could not be determined based on the given information.
event_breakdown: US Naval Forces Central Command (NAVCENT) rescued the crew from the M/V Tutor, a bulk carrier attacked by Yemen’s Iran-aligned Houthis on 12 June in the Red Sea. The abandoned vessel was drifting in the Red Sea near the Yemeni port of Hodeidah.

title: Israel - Hamas : Benjamin Netanyahu disbands war cabinet after Benny Gantz quits government
message:
Jerusalem: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu has dissolved the six-member war cabinet, an Israeli official said on Monday, in a widely expected move following the departure from government of centrist former general Benny Gantz.
Netanyahu is now expected to hold consultations about the Gaza war with a small group of ministers, including Defence Minister Yoav Gallant and Strategic Affairs Minister Ron Dermer who had been in the war cabinet.
Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu speaks during a news conference in Tel Aviv, Israel.
Credit: APThe move was announced as US special envoy Amos Hochstein visited Jerusalem, seeking to calm the situation on the disputed border with Lebanon, where Israel said tensions with the Iran-backed Hezbollah militia were bringing the region close to a wider conflict.
The Israeli military said on Monday it had killed a senior operative in one of Hezbollah’s rocket and missile sections in the area of Selaa in southern Lebanon.
event_breakdown: US envoy Amos Hochstein visits Jerusalem to calm tensions between Israel and the Iran-backed Hezbollah militia, which has brought the region close to a conflict, especially in the disputed area on the Lebanon border.

title: Woman , 24 , arrested in fatal gang shooting in Anaheim , police say
message:
Editor’s Note: A previous version of this story incorrectly said, because of a reporting error, that Jannet Cureno was also arrested on suspicion of the stabbing.
A 24-year-old woman suspected of fatally shooting a man in a gang-related crime in a residential Anaheim neighborhood was arrested on Saturday, June 15, authorities said.
Information on who stabbed the man was not immediately released by authorities.
Jannett Cureno, 24, fled the scene and was later arrested in Santa Ana on suspicion of the shooting, police said.
Anaheim police have asked anyone with information about the shooting to contact them at 714-321-3669 or Orange County Crime Stoppers, anonymously, at 855-TIP-OCCS.
event_breakdown:
Location: 700 block of River Street, Anaheim, CA
Police have arrested a 24-year-old woman for fatally shooting a man in a gang-related crime in a residential neighborhood in Anaheim, authorities said on Saturday.
The woman, Jannet Cureno, fled the scene and was later arrested in Santa Ana, police said.
Anyone with information about the crime is asked to contact Anaheim police at 714-321-3669 or Orange County Crime Stoppers anonymously at 855-TIP-OCCS.

title: Charges filed against suspect in Plainfield Township attack | Newsradio WOOD 1300 and 106 . 9 FM
message:
PLAINFIELD TOWNSHIP, Mich. -- Kent County Prosecutor Chris Becker says his office has filed charges against the 24-year-old suspect in a break-in and stabbing in Plainfield Township.
Kent County Sheriff's investigators say the Plainfield Township man broke into the home early Saturday morning and stabbed an 11-year-old girl repeatedly.
Becker says 24-year-old Ricardo Perez Castillo as been charged with one count of assault with intent to murder, one count of home invasion 1st degree, one count of assault with intent to commit criminal sexual conduct involving penetration.
Kent County Undersheriff Bryan Muir says the 11-year-old was staying at a friend's house when the attack occurred.
Police believe it was a random attack.

title: IDF eliminates key Hezbollah operative during lull in rocket fire
message:
The IDF, for its part, has not stopped its rocket fire, and on Monday Hezbollah announced another operative has been eliminated: Muhammad Mustafa Ayoub, from the town of Selaa in southern Lebanon.
Hours after the assassination, the IDF published documentation of the attack on Ayoub, who it described as "a key operative in the Rocket and Missile Department of Hezbollah's Nasser Unit."
3 View gallery The IDF eliminated key Hezbollah operative Muhammad Mustafa AyoubOver the past few months, Ayoub was involved in promoting terror attacks against Israeli civilians and communities; he promoted and planned terror attacks from southern Lebanon against the State of Israel, according to the IDF.
Hezbollah has pledged to continue fighting in the north as long as the IDF continues its operation in the Gaza Strip, so the lull in attacks in recent days is unusual.
A possible reason for the current quiet is the Eid al-Adha holiday, or the Feast of Sacrifice, which includes mass prayers by the residents of southern Lebanon.

title: Russian attack on Ukraine Poltava region injures nine , causes power cuts
message:
A Russian missile attack on Ukraine’s east-central Poltava region on Monday injured 22 people, including three children, and damaged dwellings and power lines, knocking out electricity for more than 55,000 consumers, the regional governor said.
Ukraine’s general prosecutor’s office, in a post on Telegram, said the attack was carried out with an X-59 cruise missile.
Poltava Governor Filip Pronin posted footage of himself at the scene of the attack, with smoke rising from damaged garages, while emergency services battled fires.
Pronin said that owing to damage to power lines, some 53,000 private and 2,400 industrial consumers faced electricity cuts.
location: The main location of the event is Poltava, Ukraine.

title: Elyria man under arrest for stabbing victim in the face
message:
LORAIN COUNTY, Ohio (WOIO) - Elyria police arrested a 41-year-old man for allegedly stabbing another man multiple times in the face and head.
The attack happened on June 16 in a vacant lot near West Avenue and 16th Street.
Police responded to University Hospital Elyria Medical Center around 10:15 a.m. after the victim was brought to the emergency room.
While officers were at the assault scene, they said they located Andrew Davison who admitted to the crime and was still armed with the knife.
Andrew Davison ((Source: Elyria police))Davison is charged with felonious assault and aggravated robbery.

title: Israel bombs south , kills one as Hezbollah pauses operations for Eid
message:
Relative calm prevailed in southern Lebanon on Sunday and Monday as Hezbollah appeared to pause its cross-border attacks on Israel for the Eid al-Adha holiday.
Earlier that day, Israeli forces fired machine guns at residents of Dhayra, a border town, as they inspected their properties and visited a cemetery.
Additionally, an Israeli aircraft launched two missiles at Mays al-Jabal, a border town, while artillery shelling targeted the border towns of Khiam, Kfar Hamam, Rashaya al-Fukhar, and Kfarkela, along with the Marjeyoun plain.
On Sunday, several border towns were subjected to a few airstrikes and intermittent artillery shelling.
Israel and Hezbollah, an ally of Hamas, have engaged in near-daily cross-border fire since the October 7 attack by the Palestinian militant group on Israel, which ignited the war in the Gaza Strip.

title: Sun Prairie police warn against use of Orbeez guns
message:
Sun Prairie police are warning against the use of real-looking toy guns that shoot gel-filled balls, saying a recent uptick in their use has sometimes led to physical altercations and injuries.
The fake weapons, made by Orbeez Guns and other manufacturers, shoot gel-filled ammunition, known as Orbeez, and are illegal under city ordinance, the police department said in a news release Monday.
Lt. Ray Thomson said that in the past seven days, officers have responded to 13 calls about the guns, and 26 since May 19.
In one of those cases, a young adult struck a child who had been shooting the young adult with one of the guns, Thomson said.
City ordinance prohibits discharging or throwing "by any means any dangerous missile ... within the city," not including school district archery practice.

title: Netanyahu dissolves influential war Cabinet
message:
TEL AVIV, Israel — Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu dissolved the influential war Cabinet that has overseen the fighting in Gaza, a government spokesperson said Monday, days after a key member of the body bolted from the government over frustration with the Israeli leader’s handling of the war.
The move to scrap the war Cabinet comes as Israel faces more pivotal decisions.
The Israeli military said it tracked just two missiles fired Monday from Lebanon, and they did not enter Israeli territory.
Former army chief and fellow party member Gadi Eisenkot left the war Cabinet, where he had observer status.
Without the support of Gantz’s party, Netanyahu is expected to be more beholden to far-right allies.

title: Kremlin to attack US ships with nuclear submarines
message:
ALBAWABA - After a Russian submarine landed in Cuba for military drills, a Russian military expert said the Kremlin intended to launch nuclear attacks on American ships.
Igor Korotchenko said on Russian state media that the nuclear-powered submarine Kazan is the sole Northern Fleet vessel in Cuba.
However, he noted that multiple multi-purpose Russian nuclear submarines execute varied missions in the Atlantic Ocean.
Russian warships and a nuclear submarine are just off the coast of Florida in Havana.
In response to American long-range assaults on Russian territory, Korotchenko suggested destroying all Ukrainian power plants quickly and efficiently.

title: Germany to resume Afghan deportations via Uzbekistan - Newspaper
message:
FRANKFURT: Ger­many’s government is holding talks with Uzbekistan to enable deportations from Germany to Afghanistan without direct consultations with the Taliban, according to a report in German magazine Der Spiegel on Sunday.
It stopped deportations to Afghanistan after the Tali­ban took power in 2021.
The Uzbek government wants to sign a formal migration agreement with Germany before a deal on deportations, the Spiegel report said.
Officials had been carrying out an “intensive review for several mon­ths… to allow the deportation of serious criminals and dangerous individuals to Afghanistan”, Interior Minister Nancy Faeser told journalists.
Deportations to Afgha­nis­tan from Germany have been completely stopped since the Taliban retook power in 2021.

title: KEIN YIRBU : IDF Wipes Out 50 % Of Hamas Terrorists In Rafah
message:
The IDF announced Monday that it has dismantled approximately half of Hamas’ fighting force in Rafah.
The IDF’s 162nd Division has been engaged in intense fighting in Rafah for over 40 days, gradually gaining control over key areas.
According to the IDF, at least 550 gunmen have been killed in the Rafah operation, with many more terror operatives killed in strikes against buildings and tunnels.
The IDF has established “complete operational control” over the Brazil neighborhood and the NPK neighborhood of Rafah, near the Shaboura and Yabna camps.
The latter neighborhood is considered a major Hamas stronghold, and the army claims to have killed dozens of gunmen inside tunnels there.

title: South Korea loudspeakers face questions over reach into North

South Korea resumed loudspeaker broadcasts directed at North Korea on June 9 for the first time since a now-defunct inter-Korean agreement banned them in 2018.
Kim Sung-min, who defected from the North in 1999 and runs a Seoul radio station that broadcasts news into North Korea, said the mountainous border terrain and North Korea’s own loudspeakers in the area further diminish the reach of South Korea’s psychological warfare.
North Korea’s broadcasts are less aimed at winning over people in the South and more at “suppressing” the South’s broadcasts by overpowering or muddling the message, he said.
At least two North Korean soldiers from the frontlines defected to the South in 2017 after listening to loudspeaker broadcasts, local media reported, citing South Korean officials.

title: IAF contingent participates in Exercise Red Flag 2024 at Alaska
message:
An Indian Air Force (IAF) contingent participated in Exercise Red Flag 2024, conducted at Eielson Air Force Base, Alaska, of the United States Air Force, from June 4 to June 14, the Ministry of Defence said in a release on Sunday.
This was the second edition of Exercise Red Flag 2024, which is an advanced aerial combat training exercise held four times a year by the US Air Force.
According to the release, the exercise witnessed the participation of the Indian Air Force along with the Republic of Singapore Air Force (RSAF), Royal Air Force (RAF) of the United Kingdom, Royal Netherlands Air Force (RNLAF), German Luftwaffe, and the US Air Force (USAF).
Red Flag is an air combat exercise conducted with multiple scenarios designed to provide realistic combat settings.
Enriched with the Red Flag exercise experience, the IAF keenly looks forward to hosting the participating contingents from other countries during Ex-Tarang Shakti-2024, which is the first-ever Indian multinational air exercise to be held later this year, the release added.
event_breakdown: Location: Eielson Air Force Base, Alaska (USA)

The U.N.’s Palestinian refugee agency UNHCR stated that humanitarian aid stretched beyond its capacity is “causing the suffering of so many families.” It also called for “immediate assistance,” reporting that the population of the Gaza Strip will reach more than 1.8 million people by December.

Palestinian officials condemned the “tactical pause” as a cover for Israel’s ongoing blockade of the Gaza Strip. Palestinian Authority Minister of Women’s Affairs Nabila Espanioly told al-Hayat al-Jadida that “the pause is only on paper. In practice, there is no reduction in the siege.”

title: U . S . Navy Rescues Crew from Vessel Struck by Houthis
message:
By Carrier Strike Group Two Public Affairs | June 16, 2024RED SEA –Sailors assigned to the Dwight D. Eisenhower Carrier Strike Group (IKECSG) airlifted the crew of a merchant vessel attacked by Iranian-backed Houthis in the Red Sea, June 15.
The Liberian-flagged, Greek-owned bulk cargo carrier M/V Tutor was struck by an Iranian-back Houthi uncrewed surface vessel (USV) while sailing in the international waters of the Southern Red Sea, June 12.
A helicopter from Helicopter Maritime Strike Squadron (HSM) 74 airlifted 24 civilian mariners from Tutor to Ticonderoga-class guided-missile cruiser USS Philippine Sea (CG 58).
From there, helicopters from Helicopter Sea Combat Squadron (HSC) 7 transported the group to USS Dwight D. Eisenhower (CVN 69).
“It’s humbling to watch the Strike Group provide assistance and rescue the crew of M/V Tutor,” said Rear Adm. Marc Miguez, commander, IKECSG, Carrier Strike Group 2.
event_breakdown: Carrier Strike Group 2’s helicopter squadrons save merchant vessel crew in Red Sea from Houthi USV attack

title: Netanyahu dissolves influential War Cabinet
message:
TEL AVIV, Israel — Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu dissolved the influential war Cabinet that oversaw the fighting in Gaza, a government spokesperson said Monday, days after a key member of the body bolted from the government over frustration with the Israeli leader's handling of the war.
The move to scrap the war Cabinet comes as Israel faces more pivotal decisions.
The Israeli military said it tracked just two missiles fired Monday from Lebanon, and they did not enter Israeli territory.
Former army chief and fellow party member Gadi Eisenkot left the war Cabinet, where he had observer status.
Without the support of Gantz's party, Netanyahu is expected to be more beholden to far-right allies.

Rostov Oblast borders Ukraine to the southeast.

title: One man dead , another wounded in Staten Island knife fight
message:
One man was killed and another was wounded in a Staten Island knife fight Monday, police and sources said.
The men, ages 41 and 37, got into a fight at the corner of Broad and Gordon Sts.
Both men, armed with knives, took swipes at each other until eventually the older man was stabbed in the chest and the younger in the leg, sources said.
Medics rushed the 41-year-old man to Staten Island University Hospital, but he could not be saved.
The younger man was taken to Richmond University Medical Center, where he was expected to survive his injuries.
event_breakdown: One killed, one wounded in Staten Island knife fight

title: Woodstock woman accused of stabbing little brother guilty on all counts
message:
articleA Woodstock woman who was accused of stabbing her little brother so severely that she punctured his lung was found guilty on all counts.
She was charged with stabbing her brother in his left chest, abdomen and shoulder with a knife that she grabbed from her purse during an argument.
Woodstock and Cherokee County officials provided lifesaving treatment for the teen who was rushed to the hospital with a punctured left lung.
It resulted in a collapsed lung, a lacerated blood vessel in the lung and bruising and lacerations to the lung.
A Cherokee County jury heard from six witnesses from the State, including her brother, their mother, three law enforcement officers and the trauma surgeon, and one witness from the Defense, Williams.

The child’s 4-year-old brother was shot in the leg, and the boys’ mother was hit in the abdomen and leg during the random attack in Rochester Hills.

title: South Korean soldiers fire warning shots after North Korean troops
message:
SEOUL, South Korea (AP) — South Korean soldiers fired warning shots to repel North Korean soldiers who temporarily crossed the rivals’ land border Tuesday for the second time this month, South Korea’s military said.
The work has gone on uninterrupted despite several explosions caused by mines that killed or injured an unspecified number of North Korean soldiers, said the South’s Joint Chiefs of Staff.
It said the North Korean soldiers retreated after the South broadcasts warnings and fired warning shots and the South’s military didn’t spot any suspicious activity after that.
The South also fired warning shots on June 11 after another group of North Korean soldiers briefly crossed the MDL.
It said it doesn’t believe the North Korean soldiers intruded the border intentionally and that the North did not return fire.

title: South Korea fires warning shots after North Korea soldiers cross border
message:
South Korean forces fired warning shots after North Korean troops breached the heavily guarded military demarcation line close to the border on Tuesday, according to a report from the Yonhap news agency which cited information from the country's Joint Chiefs of Staff.
South Korean soldiers responded by broadcasting warnings and firing warning shots, prompting the North Korean soldiers to retreat.
Following the incident, the South's military did not observe any further suspicious activities.This incident follows a similar incident that occurred on June 11, when South Korean soldiers fired warning shots to deter another group of North Korean soldiers who briefly crossed the MDL.
According to the Joint Chiefs of Staff, Tuesday's incident took place in a different area along the central frontline region.
The South's military believes that the North Korean soldiers did not intentionally intrude across the border, and the North did not return fire.In recent weeks, the South's military has observed an increase in North Korean construction activity along the frontline border areas.

title: U . S . designates Iran - aligned Ansar Allah al - Awfiya as terrorist organization
message:
The State Department under U.S. Secretary of State Antony Blinken on Monday designated the Iran-aligned Harakat Ansar Allah al-Awfiya as a terrorist organization.
File Photo by NATO Press/UPI | License PhotoJune 18 (UPI) -- The United States has designated Iraq-based Harakat Ansar Allah al-Awfiya as a terrorist organization as the Biden administration cracks down Iran proxy militias amid Israel's war in Gaza.
The U.S. State Department sanctioned the Iran-backed group as a Specially Designated Global Terrorist organization along with its 46-year-old secretary general, Muzhir Ma'lak al-Sa'idi.
Harakat Ansar Allah al-Awfiya is part of the Islamic Resistance in Iraq, which has claimed responsibility for several recent attacks from Iraq and Syria targeting U.S. military, including a January drone strike that killed three U.S. service members in Jordan.
The U.S. State Department said Harakat Ansar Allah al-Awfiya was involved in the strike.

On Monday, the U.S. State Department designated Iraq-based Harakat Ansar Allah al-Awfiya as a terrorist organization. The group, which has close ties to Iran, has been involved in several recent attacks targeting U.S. service members in Iraq and Jordan. The U.S. State Department said the sanctions against the group and its leader are aimed at preventing future attacks and disrupting Iran's support for terrorism in the region.

title: Authorities across U . S . grapple with rash of violence in final days of spring
message:

In Texas, fatal gunfire broke out at a Juneteenth celebration, with two people pronounced dead.
Other shootings and stabbings, in locations from Massachusetts to Indiana, marred the days before spring turns to summer as sweltering heat takes hold in many regions.

title: Trash balloons and psychological warfare
message:
In fact, many experts believe propaganda broadcasting from the West as part of psychological warfare during the Cold War was instrumental in bringing down the Soviet Union and the Communist bloc in Eastern Europe.
In recent days, Pyongyang has sent hundreds of balloons filled with trash, including used toilet paper and cigarette butts, to the South.
In return, Seoul also decided to engage in psychological warfare.
In fact, anti-Pyongyang activists sent dozens of leaflet balloons recently in reaction to the North’s rubbish balloons.
In any case, Seoul should not rule out the possibility of engaging in old-style psychological warfare because it can work as a very viable bargaining chip.

title: Authorities across US grapple with a rash of violence in final days of spring
message:
(AP) - Communities across the country are grappling with a rash of violence in the final days of spring that included at least four mass shootings in one weekend, and continued Monday with stabbings outside an Indiana strip mall.
On Saturday, a lone gunman opened fire at a recreational splash pad in suburban Detroit, injuring nine people, including an 8-year-old who was shot in the head.
Other shootings and stabbings, in locations from Massachusetts to Indiana, marred the days before spring turns to summer as sweltering heat takes hold in many regions.
The rash of violence is a counterpoint to FBI data pointing to a sharp drop in violent crime nationwide earlier this year.
A splash pad is a recreational area with a nonslip surface where people can play in fountains and water sprays.

title: South Korean Soldiers Fire Warning Shots after North Korean Troops Intrude for 2nd Time This Month
message:
SEOUL, South Korea (AP) — South Korean soldiers fired warning shots to repel North Korean soldiers who temporarily crossed the rivals’ land border Tuesday for the second time this month, South Korea’s military said.
It said the North Korean soldiers retreated after the South broadcasts warnings and fired warning shots and the South’s military didn’t spot any suspicious activities after that.
The South also fired warning shots on June 11 after another group of North Korean soldiers briefly crossed the MDL.
The Joint Chiefs of Staff said that Tuesday’s incident occurred in a different area along the central frontline region.
It said it doesn’t believe the North Korean soldiers intruded the border intentionally and that the North did not return fire.

title: Gaza Fighting Subsides As Israel Declares  Pause  To Facilitate Aid Flow
message:
Israel struck Gaza on Monday and witnesses reported blasts in the besieged territory's south, but fighting had largely subsided on the second day of an army-declared "pause" to facilitate aid flows.
The daytime "pause" for aid deliveries around a southern Gaza route, announced at the weekend by Israel's military, appeared to be holding on Monday.
Israel's retaliatory offensive aimed at eliminating Hamas has killed at least 37,347 people in Gaza, also mostly civilians, according to the territory's health ministry.
Fighting 'as planned'Troops were still operating in Rafah and central Gaza, reporting "close-quarters combat" that killed several militants, the military said.
Biden's plan would bring an initial six-week pause to fighting and Hamas would free hostages in exchange for the release of Palestinian prisoners held by Israel.
event_breakdown: Israel struck Gaza on Monday and witnesses reported blasts in the territory's south, but fighting had largely subsided on the second day of an army-declared "pause" to facilitate aid flows.

title: Israel says killed key Hezbollah operative in drone strike
message:
A member of Hezbollah has been killed by an Israeli drone strike on a car in southern Lebanon, the country's state-run National News Agency reported.
Hezbollah issued a statement on Monday identifying the member killed in the drone strike near the village of Shehabiyeh as Mohammad Ayoub.
It said Ayoub was involved in recent months in promoting and planning attacks from southern Lebanon against Israel.
Israel said it killed Ayoub as part of its activities “to impede Hezbollah’s military build-up in terms of weaponry and its stockpiling of weapons” that would be used against Israel.
Since Oct. 8., more than 400 people have been killed in Lebanon — most of them Hezbollah fighters but also more than 70 civilians and non-combatants.

message:
International partners backed Somali army forces, killing 28 al-Shabab militants in an airstrike in a rural area on the border between the Galgadud and Middle Shabelle regions on Tuesday night.
Advertisements highlighted a senior military commander, Abdinur Yusuf Qadaye, stating that the targeted militants were planning attacks on army positions and local communities.
The government forces and their international partners, however, prevented the attack.
Operations against the al-Shabab group remain ongoing in the Galgadud and Middle Shabelle regions, with increased efforts from both ground and air forces by the army, local people, and international allies.
According to a military official who declined to be named, at least 11 other soldiers were wounded in the explosion.

title: PLA Navy submarine force makes historic breakthroughs
message:
PLA Navy's submarine force makes historic breakthroughsGlobal TimesBy Liu Xuanzun Published: Jun 17, 2024 09:29 PMThe submarine force of the Chinese People's Liberation Army (PLA) Navy has made historic breakthroughs in torpedo and missile capabilities.
Wen Xuexing, a captain at a submarine detachment of the PLA Navy, made the remarks in a report by China Central Television (CCTV) in celebration of the 70th founding anniversary of the PLA Navy's submarine force.
Wen's unit is the PLA Navy's first-ever submarine unit, which is also a "seed unit" of submarines responsible for testing and training, according to the CCTV.
The PLA Navy's submarines enable the Chinese people to develop economy in peace and have no fear of any invasion, Wen said.
According to media reports, the PLA Navy now operates Type 039 series conventional submarines, Type 09III nuclear-powered attack submarines and Type 09IV nuclear-powered ballistic missile submarines, with more advanced models under development.

title: Rebels arrested in connection to attempted attack on Myanmar chief
message:

By RFA Burmese 2024.06.17 -- Junta forces arrested 13 members of an urban guerrilla group on suspicion of planning an attack on the leader of Myanmar's military regime, Senior Gen. Min Aung Hlaing, state-run media reported.
A state-controlled newspaper reported the plot on Monday, confirming that in all 13 people had been arrested in connection with the plot to attack the army chief, who led a 2021 coup, at a Yangon bridge opening in early June.
Members of anti-junta forces, speaking to Radio Free Asia on Monday, confirmed the arrests but a member of the Yangon UG People's Army group denied that the people arrested had been attempting to attack political officials.
The member of the Yangon UG People's Army, who declined to be identified for security reasons, said the military fabricated the attack plot to justify its arrests.

Lebanon's official National News Agency said a building was hit in Jannata, 20 kilometers from the Israeli border.
Rescuers said at least nine people were wounded in the strike on Jannata, including an infant and two children.
- 'We will not be displaced' -The strike, which the Israeli military has not commented on, comes on the heels of a major Hezbollah attack.
Hezbollah launched barrages of rockets and drones on Wednesday and Thursday targeting Israeli military sites across the border, after an Israeli strike earlier this week killed a senior commander.

title: It Is Unsafe !: Chaos Erupts At New York City Council Meeting As Residents Flip Over Migrant Shelter Crime
message:
Chaos erupted between New York City (NYC) residents and City Council member Crystal Hudson during a community meeting while discussing issues with a migrant shelter nearby, video shows.
The clip opens up with Hudson addressing an issue before briefly touching on a stabbing incident that occurred outside of a Clinton Hill migrant shelter.
“Is there a universe where the city can safely have 3,200 single men together, can safely have —” he continued before Hudson could be heard cutting him off.
While other residents could be heard shouting “It can’t,” the man stood up on his chair yelling, “It is unsafe!
Authorities later arrested 25-year-old Cristian Concepcion, who lived at the shelter, and confirmed the dispute was over a moped, the outlet reported.
event_breakdown:
Chaos erupted between New York City residents and City Council member Crystal Hudson during a community meeting while discussing issues with a migrant shelter nearby, video shows.
The incident unfolded during a community meeting when Hudson was discussing issues related to the Clinton Hill migrant shelter, which is located on Fulton Street in Brooklyn, New York Post reports.

Chaos erupted at the meeting when Hudson was addressing an issue with the city’s housing of approximately 3,200 single male migrants at the shelter.

A resident stood up on his chair, declaring the facility “unsafe,” while another resident shouted, “it is unsafe! When a representative of Hudson attempted to speak, residents continued to shout over her.

Hudson attempted to talk over the cries, but the crowd only grew louder and angrier. The interaction lasted for over a minute before Hudson was able to regain control over the conversation.

The situation worsened in September when a brawl broke out around Clinton Hill, leaving five injured, one in critical condition.

Hudson faced a backlash over the incident, with many blaming her for failing to address the concerns of the residents and accusing her of not being transparent with her constituents.

title: Netanyahu Dissolves Israeli War Cabinet
message:
TEL AVIV, Israel—Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu dissolved the war Cabinet that has overseen the fighting in Gaza, a government spokesperson said Monday, days after a key member of the body quitted the government over frustration with the Israeli leader’s handling of the war.
Government officials said Mr. Netanyahu would hold smaller forums for sensitive war issues, including with his security Cabinet, which includes right-wing governing partners who oppose cease-fire deals.
The war Cabinet was formed in the early days of the war, when Mr. Gantz, then an opposition party leader and Netanyahu rival, joined the coalition in a show of unity following the Oct. 7 attack on southern Israel by Hamas terrorists.
The move to scrap the war Cabinet comes as Israel faces more pivotal decisions.
Former army chief and fellow party member Gadi Eisenkot left the war Cabinet, where he had observer status.

Inner council to be formed for sensitive war issues like ceasefire deals in Gaza.

Mitchell W. Stout, the only Air Defense Artillery Soldier to receive the Medal of Honor.
Formerly known as Maneuver-Short Range Air Defense, the SGT STOUT will protect maneuvering forces by defeating, destroying or neutralizing unmanned aircraft systems, rotary and fixed-wing aircraft, rockets, artillery and mortars.
The first two SGT STOUT battalions are in Germany and at Fort Sill, Oklahoma, and the Army recently fielded its third battalion at Fort Cavazos, Texas, in February.

title: Ukraine claims responsibility for attack on Russian oil storage tanks
message:
Ukraine claimed responsibility on Tuesday for an overnight drone attack on a Russian oil facility that started a massive blaze in the latest long-range strike by Kyiv’s forces on a border region.
Ukraine has in recent months stepped up aerial assaults on Russian soil, targeting refineries and oil terminals in an effort to slow down the Kremlin’s war machine.
The attack set fire to an oil reservoir in Russia’s Rostov region and more than 200 firefighters were at the scene, according to Rostov’s governor, Vasily Golubev.
The drones targeted two Rostov oil depots that have 22 oil reservoirs, the official said.
The unmanned aerial vehicles are also an affordable option while Ukraine waits for the arrival of more Western military aid.
event_breakdown: Ukraine claimed responsibility for a massive drone attack on a Russian oil facility near the Ukrainian border in Rostov Oblast. Ukraine has increasingly turned to drone-borne attacks on Russian gas and oil installations in the border region of the two nations in recent weeks. In this case, drones self-piloted in a coordinated set of explosions brought down damage to two sites in Rostov Oblast that are tied into oil transmission lines, creating a new crisis zone and challenge for Russian security chiefs as Ukraine ratchets up its long-range standoff with the Russian military.

title: Club Q shooter to be sentenced on federal charges for hate crimes and firearm violations
message:
(CNN) — The shooter who opened fire in a Colorado Springs LGBTQ+ nightclub, killing five people and injuring 19, is set to be sentenced for federal hate crime charges and firearm violations Tuesday.
In January, Anderson Lee Aldrich agreed to plead guilty to 74 federal hate crime charges and gun charges in connection with the shooting.
Aldrich began the massacre at the club as patrons were gathering for Transgender Day of Remembrance, for which Club Q had scheduled a weekend of events, including a drag show.
Some patrons hid or played dead as Aldrich moved though the club, shooting indiscriminately.
The shooter agreed in January to plead guilty to federal charges stemming from the Club Q shooting.

title: Ukraine claims its drones hit a Russian oil facility , sparking a huge blaze
message:
KYIV, Ukraine (AP) — Ukraine claimed responsibility Tuesday for an overnight drone attack on a Russian oil facility that started a massive blaze in the latest long-range strike by Kyiv’s forces on a border region.
Ukraine has in recent months stepped up aerial assaults on Russian soil, targeting refineries and oil terminals in an effort to slow down the Kremlin’s war machine.
The attack set fire to an oil reservoir in Russia’s Rostov region and more than 200 firefighters were at the scene, according to Rostov Gov.
The blaze covered an area of 5,000 square meters (55,000 square feet) but there were no casualties, Russia’s Emergencies Ministry said.
The drones targeted two Rostov oil depots that have 22 oil reservoirs, the official said.

Title: Ukraine Claims Responsibility for Drone Attack on Russian Oil Facility
Target:
* Event: Ukraine claimed responsibility for a drone attack on Russian oil facility

title: Rampage suspect pleads guilty in Jerome County
message:
Brandalyn Michelle Maglaughlin, 43, pleaded guilty to aggravated battery, unlawful possession of a firearm and battery on a correction officer.
For the aggravated battery charge, the most serious, prosecutors will recommend a sentence of eight years’ fixed and four years indeterminate, but with retained jurisdiction, records say.
Maglaughlin then picked up a handgun belonging to Lamm, court records say, and fired at him through a window when he fled his trailer, wounding him.
She eventually threw down the knife and gun when Jerome County deputies arrived at the scene, records say.
She was combative after being taken to the Jerome County Jail and spat at deputies as they attempted to book her and take her booking photo, records say.

title: South Korean soldiers fire warning shots after North Korean troops intrude for 2nd time this month
message:
Seoul, Jun 18 (AP) South Korean soldiers fired warning shots to repel North Korean soldiers who temporarily crossed the rivals' land border on Tuesday for the second time this month, South Korea's military said.
It said the North Korean soldiers retreated after the South broadcasts warnings and fired warning shots and the South's military didn't spot any suspicious activities after that.
The South also fired warning shots on June 11 after another group of North Korean soldiers briefly crossed the MDL.
The Joint Chiefs of Staff said that Tuesday's incident occurred in a different area along the central frontline region.
It said it doesn't believe the North Korean soldiers intruded the border intentionally and that the North did not return fire.

title: Arakan Army tells residents to evacuate ahead of attack on western Myanmar city
message:
Arakan Army tells residents to evacuate ahead of attack on western Myanmar cityA battle for the administrative center of Maungdaw township follows the recent seizure of nearby junta camps.
The Arakan Army, or AA, told residents on Sunday that they should evacuate their homes by 9 p.m.
The Arakan Army has recently seized control of all junta camps in surrounding Maungdaw township, including several key border posts.
Residents told RFA that Rohingya in junta uniforms and weapons have been seen at military camps inside the city.
They're facing shortages of food and medical supplies, an aid worker told RFA on condition of anonymity because of security reasons.

message:

title: South Korean troops fire warning shots as soldiers from North cross border
message:
South Korean soldiers fired warning shots to repel North Korean soldiers who temporarily crossed the rivals’ land border on Tuesday for the second time this month, South Korea’s military said.
The South’s military observed increased North Korean construction activities along their heavily armed border to install suspected anti-tank barriers, reinforce roads and plant land mines.
A North Korean military guard post is seen from Paju, South Korea, near the border (AP Photo/Ahn Young-joon)The South also fired warning shots on June 11 after another group of North Korean soldiers briefly crossed the Military Demarcation Line (MDL).
It said it does not believe the North Korean soldiers intruded into the border intentionally and that the North did not return fire.
The South’s military has said the border area is dense with overgrown trees and plants that may have obscured the visibility of North Korean soldiers and caused them to cross the border.
event_breakdown: North Korean soldiers temporarily cross the Military Demarcation Line (MDL), a border that divides the North and South, for the second time this month on Tuesday. South Korea soldiers repel them with warning shots.

message:

The Baltic nation, which borders Russia, has recently seen a rise in sabotage, electronic warfare and spying, all blamed on Moscow.

title: Gaza war : At least 17 Palestinians killed by Israeli airstrikes on refugee camps
message:
At least 17 Palestinians in two of Gaza's refugee camps were killed in Israeli strikes on Tuesday.
Heavy bombardments were reported in several areas as the Israeli forces pushed deeper into the southern city of Rafah.
According to the Gaza health ministry, at least 37,372 Palestinians have been killed and around 85,452 wounded in Israeli attacks on Gaza.
Over 500 Palestinians including 133 children had been killed by Israeli security forces since October last year raising concerns of unlawful killings.
Israel has intensified its Rafah attacks as Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu dissolved the war cabinet, tasked with the duty of overseeing the Gaza war.
event_breakdown:
Israeli air strikes kill 5 Palestinians in Rafah refugee camp. The Israel Air Force attacked a terrorist group in Gaza late Tuesday night, killing 5 Palestinians and wounding 15 others. The strike targeted a Hamas training facility in the northern Rafah refugee camp. According to the UNRWA, the UN agency for Palestinian refugees, the strike destroyed an UNRWA school and damaged several homes. The Israeli government said that the group targeted was planning attacks against Israeli citizens.
IDF strikes Gaza targets. Israeli warplanes struck targets in the Gaza Strip early Tuesday, reportedly killing 4 Palestinians, including a Hamas militant. The IDF strike targeted a training camp used by the group's armed wing. The IDF said that the camp was being used for attacks against Israel. The airstrike came in response to several rocket attacks launched from the Gaza Strip into Israel on Monday.
Hamas releases video of captured Israeli soldier. The IDF released a video showing a Hamas operative captured by Israeli forces in an operation in the Gaza Strip on Sunday. The soldier, identified as Gilad Shaar, can be seen being questioned by Palestinian captors. The IDF said that the soldier was unharmed and that the Israeli army was working to secure his release. The IDF did not say how the soldier was captured.

title: Israeli forces deepen Rafah invasion , kill 17 in central camps - World
message:
CAIRO: Israeli airstrikes on Tuesday killed at least 17 Palestinians in two of the Gaza Strip’s historic refugee camps and Israeli tanks pushed deeper into the enclave’s southern city of Rafah, residents and medics said.
Rafah offensive would lead to ‘humanitarian disaster’: UN chiefMost of the population has fled northwards since then as Israeli forces invaded the city.
Palestinian health officials said one man was killed in the morning by Israeli fire on the eastern side of Rafah.
The Israeli military said it was continuing “precise, intelligence-based activity” in Rafah, killing many Palestinian gunmen over the past day in close-range combat and seized weapons.
The air force struck dozens of targets across the Gaza Strip in the past day, it added.
event_breakdown: Israeli airstrikes target Gaza - 17 Palestinians are killed by airstrikes on Gaza's historic refugee camps on Tuesday, making it the deadliest day there in two years. The strikes in Gaza come as Israeli tanks pushed into the southern city of Rafah.

title: Estonia convicts a university professor from Russia for spying for Moscow
message:
A university professor was jailed Tuesday in Estonia after being found guilty of spying for Russian military intelligence.
The Baltic nation, which borders Russia, has recently seen a rise in sabotage, electronic warfare and spying, all blamed on Moscow.
Estonian officials are extremely hawkish about the threat from Russia and have convicted a number of people of spying for Russia in recent years.

title: WATCH : 40 Years Since the Battle of Orgreave
message:
The Battle of Orgreave during the 1984 British miners strike took place exactly 40 years ago today, when police attacked pickets at a coking plant outside Sheffield.
They were addressed by Arthur Scargill, who led the miners’ union during the strike, Gareth Pierce, an attorney who represented arrested Orgreave strikers, and a host of other speakers.
On this day 40 years ago, 8,000 picketing miners were confronted by 6,000 police officers at the Orgreave coking plant.
On this day in 1984, thousands of picketing miners were attacked by riot police in the Battle of Orgreave.
40 years on, we are still fighting for the truth, for justice, and for our right to strike.
event_breakdown: Battle of Orgreave (1984) - In the 1984 British miners strike, picketers clashed with police at a coking plant outside Sheffield.

title: US envoy Hochstein calls Lebanese - Israeli border situation  serious
message:
Senior Advisor to the US President Amos Hochstein (L) meets with Lebanese Parliament Speaker Nabih Berri in Beirut.
-/Parliament of Lebanon/dpaUS special envoy Amos Hochstein said Tuesday that his country was working to avoid "a greater war" between Israel and the pro-Iranian Hezbollah in south Lebanon, describing the situation as "serious."

title: UEFA Euro 2024 in Germany city guide : Leipzig
message:
With Leipzig's Red Bull Arena set to host games at UEFA Euro 2024 in Germany, get clued up on the stadium and the city in our guides.
Stadium: Red Bull ArenaLeipzig's Red Bull Arena has stood in its current form since 2004, when it was reconstructed within the city's old Zentralstadion in a manner similar to Chicago's Soldier Field.
The rebuild was done for the 2006 FIFA World Cup in Germany, where Leipzig hosted five games.
How to get to the Red Bull Arena:The Red Bull Arena is well connected in the Leipzig public transport network.
RB Leipzig took over the stadium in 2010 and have called the Red Bull Arena home ever since.
location: The main location where the main event takes place is 'Leipzig, Germany'.
event_breakdown: The Red Bull Arena stands as Leipzig's soccer-specific home and has staged five games in the 2006 FIFA World Cup. There's also RB Leipzig, who have used the stadium since 2010.
